text: make a module. use hubl replace filter with a shortcode they can use: `[[ auto_rate ]]`
Hi <@U022FJKR4CQ> thank you! So I was able to do that now and it works without me entering any hubl in the email itself. Although the module itself cannot be dragged inline within a text content.
then replace the shortcode with the hubdb val
you can use the shortcode in the module’s rich text – which would be inline with the email text
Thank you <@U3T21PDBK> not sure if I understand the "shortcode". I assume you are speaking of an additional step after creating the module? Which I can then insert in another text element?

<@UGDF9EBPW> made a <https://www.linkedin.com/search/results/content/?keywords=hubl%20shortcode&sid=sBs&update=urn%3Ali%3Afs_updateV2%3A(urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7014250003913179136%2CBLENDED_SEARCH_FEED%2CEMPTY%2CDEFAULT%2Cfalse)|cool tut on this>. Check it out!
Thank you <@U3T21PDBK> and <@UGDF9EBPW> for making the video!
